name: Monica Dinculescu
title: Google
bio: Monica is an emojineer at Google. She works on Polymer, web components and Chrome, and has probably at least once broken the Internet for you. She is unreasonably excited about emoji, wary of web fonts, and will become your best friend if you bring her cheese. On second thought, she may be a mouse.

name: Alex Russell
title: Google
bio: Alex Russell is a Software Engineer on Chrome team where he designs new features for the Web Platform and leads Chrome‚Äôs Standards work. His recent projects include Web Components, ES6 features (Classes and Promises), and Service Workers. Previously he helped build Chrome Frame and led the Dojo Toolkit project. Alex plays for Team Web.

name: Rob Dodson
title: Google
bio: Rob Dodson is a developer advocate at Google where he focuses on Web Components and Accessibility. His mission is to fight for a better web and to help developers build great experiences. You can catch him every other week on his YouTube series "A11ycasts" and "Polycasts", or on his blog at robdodson.me.

name: Taylor Savage
title: Google
bio: Taylor is a Product Manager on the Google Web Platform Team, focused on Polymer and Progressive Web Apps. Prior to Polymer, Taylor worked launching new features on Google Search. He enjoys cooking, eating, and tinkering with Raspberry Pi's.

name: Ben Galbraith
title: Google
bio: Ben Galbraith is a Director of Product Management for Chrome, focused on the present and future of the web platform. Prior to Google, Ben has alternated between entrepreneurial and executive roles across several industries and has held leadership roles in organizations like Mozilla, Palm during the webOS era, and Walmart Labs. When not at work, he‚Äôs trying to get some of his eight kids interested in software development.

name: Dion Almaer
title: Google
bio: I love helping developers be successful as that results in happy users. I enjoy watching the constantly evolving experiment that is the Web, and long to see it grow and prosper.

name: Matt McNulty
title: Google
bio: Matthew is the Engineering Director and founder of the Polymer team at Google Chrome. Prior to that, he was a core member of the webOS team at Palm, focused on the UI, core apps, and the SDK and Developer Platform organizations.

name: Wendy Ginsberg
title: Google
bio: Wendy is a Product Manager on the Polymer team based in San Francisco. She spent the past year working on the Google Store, and is currently working with Google's Project Reconnect to help build online communities for youth refugee homes in Germany. Prior to Google, Wendy studied Computer Science at Brown University, where she focused on Data Science and developing introductory courses.

name: Jesiah McCann
title: Gannett
bio: Jesiah manages development of core web products @ Gannett / USA TODAY. He has been with Gannett for 5 years, and is currently leading the development of their emerging web platform. Jesiah is a blacksmith in his spare time, and has a slight obsession with all things coffee.

name: Josh Trout
title: Gannett
bio: Josh has been working at Gannett for over 3 years and is a principal developer on the web team. He is currently architecting the next generation framework for Gannett's 100+ newspaper sites.

name: Marianne Epstein
title: Gannett
bio: Marianne Epstein is a Senior UX Architect with Gannett Product, focused on building a flexible, scalable design system to meet the needs of the USA TODAY NETWORK‚Äôs readers, journalists, developers and designers. Outside of work (and mostly off of screens) she creates artist books.

name: Gray Norton
title: Google
bio: Gray is a passionate Web advocate and a Technical Lead / Manager on the Polymer team. Prior to joining Google he led the Enyo framework team at webOS, helping developers build apps for several generations of phones, tablets, TVs and watches. In past lives, he has worked on software tools for creating chatbots, 3D games and pretty pictures. When not at work, Gray enjoys spending time with his family and occasionally singing.

name: Sam Thorogood
title: Google
bio: Sam is Google's lead Santaware Engineer üéÅüéÑü§∂üéÖ inside Google's Developer Relations team, and every year builds Google's Santa Tracker website (with Polymer). He also is a strong believer in standards <https://goo.gl/Ed1G47> and using the platform‚ÄîWeb Components, ES6 Modules, modern EcmaScript‚Äîand polyfills over 3rd-party libraries. Hailing from Australia üá¶üá∫, he likes to travel but suffers from a lack of 2nd language skills.

name: Steve Orvell
title: Google
bio: Steve is an engineer working on the core library of the Polymer project. He works on the foundation code, DOM scoping, and the data system. He's been on the project since the beginning about 4 years ago and has participated in the spec process for Custom Elements and Shadow DOM. Before Polymer, Steve worked on WebOS at HP and Palm. In addition to coding, Steve enjoys running, biking, and traveling.

name: Kevin Schaaf
title: Google
bio: Kevin is a software engineer focusing on core features of the Polymer library. Kevin got his start in web development at a Tokyo startup back in the Netscape/IE5 days, and then took a long hiatus from the web while working in embedded electronics. Kevin returned back to the web in full force several years ago after joining Palm to work on the webOS developer platform and later leading the development of LG‚Äôs smart TV UI framework before joining the Polymer team at Google.

name: Surma
title: Google
bio: Surma is an engineer working with the Chrome team. He likes to cut himself on the bleeding edge, goes full-stack every once in a while and prefers good code over functional one.

name: Martin Splitt
title: Archilogic
bio: Martin is open source contributor and web evangelist by heart from Zurich with a decade experience from the trenches of software engineering in multiple fields. He works as a software engineer at Archilogic in front- and backend. He devotes his time to moving the web forward, fixing problems, building applications and systems and breaking things for fun & profit. Martin believes in the web platform and is working with bleeding edge technologies that will allow the web to prosper.

name: Chad Killingsworth
title: Jack Henry and Associates
bio: Chad is a Software Engineer for Jack Henry & Associates where he builds modern online banking experiences for U.S. banks using Polymer. Chad contributes to many open source projects including Google‚Äôs Closure Compiler and generally advocates for strongly typed and highly performant JavaScript to anyone within earshot.

name: Maria Hussman
title: ETH Zurich (PhD Student)
bio: Maria is a PHD student at ETH Zurich working at the intersection of human computer interaction and web engineering. She is researching how developers can build applications that distribute their UI across multiple devices. Previously she worked as a software engineer on traffic control projects. This autumn, Maria will start a part-time position as a lecturer in the Digital Ideation programme at the Lucerne University of Applied Sciences and Arts.

name: Kunal Kundaje
title: Netflix
bio: Kunal Kundaje is a Senior Software Engineer at Netflix on the Cloud and Platform team, where he works on interesting problems at the unique intersection of large-scale distributed systems in the cloud and front-end web development. Prior to Netflix, Kunal traveled around the U.S. at ThoughtWorks, working with clients in the retail, media, healthcare, and airline industries on a variety of responsive web and mobile consumer apps.

name: Ziling Zhao
title: Google
bio: Ziling Zhao is a software engineer at Google working on the YouTube web architecture team. Before this team, he worked on the YouTube main desktop website and devops/site reliability at Google on a small photo editing team called Picnik. At Youtube, he has worked on the search frontend, the desktop/mobile website, and was a technical lead on latency. His current focus is on the shared web infrastructure of YouTube Web Applications.

name: Mikhail Sychev
title: Google
bio: Mikhail Sychev is a senior software engineer at Google. For the last 5 years he has been part of the YouTube Desktop team, helping to build YouTube's next generation web experience. Mikhail is a huge advocate of the Polymer web framework and an engineer behind WebP thumbnails at YouTube and YouTube on Cardboard. Prior to Google, Mikhail worked as a software engineer at Apartama. Mikhail earned his master‚Äôs degree from MIIT at Moscow, Russia.

name: Mariko Kosaka
title: Google
bio: Mariko is a developer advocate at Google working on the open web.  If she is not in front of a laptop, she is probably drawing or knitting.

name: Sam Li
title: Google
bio: Chrome engineer on the Polymer team. Recently moved from Sydney to San Francisco.
